channel.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
channel.description:
Hey all.
I've always been a fan of the Android OS, and I love the phones that are offered with Android, but I am unfortunately at a enpass determining which phone is best for me.
I love apps and such. The Android market surely has that, along with some useful apps that can really help with menial tasks. I'm looking for a phone for work and play! A phone that can handle a lot of apps running, but also has support for comic-relief.
I'm not really asking much. I'm just asking which phone do you think would be best for me. What experiences have you had with Android phones and would you recommend them?
Thanks.
Oh, and if it means anything, my phone service provider is currently T-Mobile.

item.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I don’t know, Sense alone cheapens HTC phones quite a bit. Full of those gimmicky widgets and ridiculous animations, reminds me of that poorly designed, gimmicky KDE rubbish. I mean, I’d take stock Android over that any day. But I’d settle for TouchWiz on Samsung phones.

Read full topic
item.source: What Android phone would you recommend?

item.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:22, topic:407050”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=508346.msg3742652#msg3742652 date=1315502740]

Doesn’t the Samsung Galaxy Note have better hardware than the Evo 3D? Other than the 3D screen… but thats not particular appealing.

Yeah but it’s freakin huge, and a fair bit more expensive.
Imo samsung are only good for TVs and mp3 players.
[/quote]

Eh. At the moment, I think they’re probably doing the best Android phones and tablets, which is a shame considering Apple are trying to get them banned everywhere. I used to be on HTC’s side, but I don’t really like Sense anymore.[/quote]
Hardware wise yes, but aesthetically I think the galaxy S2 looks cheap, just like that basic tocco lite that everyone seemed to get for christmas last year with an added paint job.

Read full topic
item.source: What Android phone would you recommend?

item.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Personally, I have to stick with phones that have physical keyboards, I’m hooked!

i have to use physical keyboard phones b/c my fingers sweat alot, sweaty fingers and touchscreens dont mix. but i used a nexus s had a nice sized screen so it was a pleasant experience, but i havent used it when my fingers were sweaty.

the galaxy note looks pretty cool.

Read full topic

item.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I’m definitely going for the HTC Evo 3d in a month when my contract runs out, not for the 3d cause I know everyone thinks that’s gimmicky (despite it only actually displaying on 3d enabled pictures, videos and games, and not for menus or everyday use), but for the hardware.

Though if you want the absolute fastest phone at the moment then it’s probably the Galaxy S2, I just don’t like the look of it :o

Read full topic
item.source: What Android phone would you recommend?

item.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

i hope to upgrade to the samsung epic touch 4g in january when im due for an upgrade, if i cant get that then i want the nexus s, and samsung epic 4g for a backup in case i cant get either of the first choices. the samsung prime sounds awesome(720p display?). its for verizon though. its pretty crazy they think we will have quad-core tablets by the end of this year and quad-core phone next year. i havent really looked at the android phones of other carriers, but galaxy s2 should all 3 be good.

i just recommend if you get an android phone know your getting what u pay for, so the higher end android phones are going to have decent to great performance, if you get a cheap one like a samsung moment or intercept expect sluggish performance everynow and then, bad battery life, etc. the only reason i can put up with my current pos phone is wireless tethering if it couldnt do that id just consider it a brick. im considering putting a alpha version of cm6 on it, ive seen performance nearly double.

Read full topic
item.source: What Android phone would you recommend?

item.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

Not an Android phone, but what about the HTC HD7? I think you can install an Android OS on it, but I am not entirely sure which OS to install, or how to do so in the first place.

Your response to this would be greatly appreciated.

Read full topic

item.source: What Android phone would you recommend?

item.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“mutex_, post:4, topic:407050”][size=36pt]iPhone 5[/size]

[size=4pt]http://www.www.godlikeproductions.com/sm/custom/iobqtirt.jpeg[/size][/quote]

No.[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:407050”]Any android phone will work fine for what you listed, they all run the same apps.

The things you have to consider is what you want hardware-wise. Do you want a physical keyboard? (I do) Do you want a large screen? (it’s bigger) or a small phone? Need an HDMI port? What about the camera? Do you want a flash or to be able to record in 720p? Those are the things you have to consider.

Personally, I want the new Droid 3, but only if Motorola provides a bootloader unlocking option like they promised.[/quote]

Oh my, all of which you said sound very nice. What I am mainly looking for though is an Android phone that can handle a lot of apps running at once, and is very flexible. I heard some good reviews about the MyTouch 4G and the HTC EVO, but I’m not entirely sure.

What have you used?

Read full topic

item.title: What Android phone would you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Any android phone will work fine for what you listed, they all run the same apps.

The things you have to consider is what you want hardware-wise. Do you want a physical keyboard? (I do) Do you want a large screen? (it’s bigger) or a small phone? Need an HDMI port? What about the camera? Do you want a flash or to be able to record in 720p? Those are the things you have to consider.

Personally, I want the new Droid 3, but only if Motorola provides a bootloader unlocking option like they promised.

Read full topic
